sentences.english: She heard them whispering conspiratorially in the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 她听到他们在卧室里窃窃私语。

sentences.english: After ten years his neighbors were snickering behind his back.
sentences.chinese: 十年过去了，他的邻居在他背后窃窃私语。

sentences.english: The women began to whisper behind their hands.
Whispers passed along, and a boding uneasiness took possession of every countenance.
sentences.chinese: 到处窃窃私语，人人脸上露出不祥的焦虑。

sentences.english: What matters it to thee what here is whispered?
sentences.chinese: 人家的窃窃私语与你何干？

sentences.english: They sat there billing and cooing till after midnight.
sentences.chinese: 他们坐在那里窃窃私语直到后半夜。

sentences.english: I heard sighs and mysterious whisperings about my bed.
sentences.chinese: 在床的四周，听得到有人在叹息以及窃窃私语。

sentences.english: Several rows behind him two gentlemen began whispering.
sentences.chinese: 排在他身后的两位绅士开始窃窃私语。

sentences.english: As if even hear them to steal steal murmurous , gesticulate.
sentences.chinese: 甚至仿佛听到他们窃窃私语，指指点点。

sentences.english: Just then, Khruschev noticed that all the Indonesians present were staring at him, whispering and tittering.
sentences.chinese: 这时，赫鲁晓夫发现周围的人露出微笑并窃窃私语。

sentences.english: The whispering in class aggravates our teacher.
sentences.chinese: 课堂上的窃窃私语使我们的老师很恼火。

sentences.english: Is a retreat from unhappy cable legislation, a pair of lovers was whispering leaned.
sentences.chinese: 一个是郁郁寡欢离群索立，一对则情侣依偎窃窃私语。

sentences.english: He turned aside and whispered something to the man standing next to him.
sentences.chinese: 他转到一边与站在他身边的那个人窃窃私语。

definition: to whisper to one another's ear
to roar with laughter/hoots of laughter/guffaw
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
to look at each other in dismay (idiom)
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
lively discussion with everybody talking at once
to prick up one's ears/to strain to hear sth
to discuss in whispered tones/whispered conversation
the whole room roaring with laughter (idiom)
